claim: Citizens of Cheshire sing La Marseillaise.

supporting.text: La Marseillaise is the national anthem of France, not associated with Cheshire, a county in England.

attacks.text: La Marseillaise is the national anthem of France, not associated with Cheshire, a county in England.
There could be cultural exchange events where citizens of Cheshire sing La Marseillaise as a gesture of goodwill or celebration.
Such events would be rare and not representative of the general behavior of Cheshire citizens.
Historical records or news articles might document instances of Cheshire citizens singing La Marseillaise, lending credibility to the claim.

supporting.text: There is no historical or cultural evidence linking Cheshire citizens to the singing of La Marseillaise.

attacks.text: There is no historical or cultural evidence linking Cheshire citizens to the singing of La Marseillaise.
La Marseillaise is the national anthem of France, and there is no record of it being adopted or sung regularly in Cheshire.
Cheshire has its own distinct cultural traditions, and there is no evidence of French influence significant enough to adopt La Marseillaise.
While Cheshire may not have historical ties to La Marseillaise, individual citizens could still sing it for personal or educational reasons.
Singing foreign anthems is rare without a specific cultural or historical context, making widespread singing in Cheshire unlikely.

supporting.text: Cheshire has its own local traditions and songs, none of which include La Marseillaise.

attacks.text: Cheshire has its own local traditions and songs, none of which include La Marseillaise.
Some residents of Cheshire may have French heritage and sing La Marseillaise as part of cultural celebrations.
The presence of French heritage individuals does not imply widespread adoption of La Marseillaise as a local tradition.
La Marseillaise is widely recognized and could be sung in Cheshire during international events or sports matches.
Singing during international events does not make La Marseillaise a local tradition of Cheshire.

supporting.text: The claim contradicts the general practice of national anthems being tied to their respective countries, not foreign regions like Cheshire.

attacks.text: The claim contradicts the general practice of national anthems being tied to their respective countries, not foreign regions like Cheshire.
Cultural exchanges and historical events can lead to foreign anthems being adopted in regions outside their origin, including Cheshire.
There is no documented evidence of La Marseillaise being officially or unofficially adopted in Cheshire.
Local traditions or events in Cheshire might have led to the anthem being sung on specific occasions, even if not widely documented.
